Text.Value: He succeeded. The Netherbrain is defeated.
And the tadpoles have fallen silent, I take it? Good.
The tadpole - I can't feel it anymore. And here I was worried I'd become some grotesque, deformed beast.
...The parasite. It's withered, dead along with the Netherbrain. I am cleansed! I will never be a filthy ghaik.
The city must remember him. Not just for his triumph, but for his courage.
Gale was many things - but he was a hero, at the very end. That is how he ought to be remembered.

EditorData.NodeContext: Mock horror - actually willing to joke now the day has been won

Text.Value: Boo will raise a statue in Gale's name. It will be the size of a planet to honour the size of Gale's courage.

EditorData.NodeContext: Satisfied, taking in the scene of our victory

Text.Value: His was a noble sacrifice.
We prevailed, but only thanks to Gale.
May he find the rest he deserves. Such an act will be remembered. And in its memory, he will live on.
Even when my time in the Prism stretched out like eternity - when escape seemed impossible - I never lost hope.
I will ensure that all our people know his name - and his sacrifice. What he has done today will start a fire that rages across the Astral Plane.
I will ensure that all githyanki know his name - and his sacrifice. What he has done today will start a fire that rages across the Astral Plane.
He sacrificed his life for everyone. He may not have been a warrior, but he fought better than any of us.
And the tadpole is gone at last.
And the tadpole's gone. Finally.
Boo will be sad for Gale. He was the best wizard Boo ever knew. The only wizard close to Boo's power.

EditorData.NodeContext: Satisfied, taking in the scene of our victory

Text.Value: He did it... he actually did it... he blew up the Netherbrain.
He did it... he actually did it... he blew up the Netherbrain.

EditorData.NodeContext: Stunned relief. Karlach starting to flag; she's not feeling great (will die soon, but still on her feet for now).

Text.Value: I can't feel the tadpole. By the Triad, I am cleansed - I will never be a mind flayer!
I can't feel the tadpole. By the Triad, we're cleansed - we will never be mind flayers!
Strange... I miss him. More than I thought I would.
But Gale... I can't believe he's gone.
He succeeded. He destroyed the Netherbrain.
He recognised he was the least of us, and spent his life to ensure our survival. That showed wisdom.
That wizard took a risk, and it looks like it paid off. The brain is destroyed.

EditorData.NodeContext: Exhausted, but appraising the ruined city skyline after we saved the city. She's not being sarcastic - actually impressed.

Text.Value: Gale gave his life for us, for everyone... and now he's gone.
Gale gave his life for us, for everyone... and now he's gone.

EditorData.NodeContext: Karlach starting to flag; she's not feeling great (will die soon, but still on her feet for now).

Text.Value: *And it's all thanks to Gale, the wizard who saved Baldur's Gate.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Big sound of explosion. Reuse any shots of party looking up at burning city that we can. (It's burning from previous attacks by nautiloids and dragons, not from Gale's explosion.)
EditorData.InternalNodeContext: This picks up from END_BrainBattle_GaleExplosion where Gale blows himself up on top of the brain after having teleported the party to safety.
EditorData.VFXTags: [Wilson] Continuation bomb VFX and SFX from Gale Explosion scene
EditorData.logicalname: Gale blew himself up alone. Everyone safe

Text.Value: Gale... he did it, he really did it. The Netherbrain is defeated.
And we are cleansed. The tadpoles are still, at last.
Of course, it did cost us a wizard. But - well, it was his choice.
But he'll never be forgotten. His name - his sacrifice - will live forever.
But we'll never forget him. And neither will the city he saved.

EditorData.NodeContext: Sadness for Gale's loss but proud of him

Text.Value: The tadpoles must have died with the brain in the explosion. The threat of ceremorphosis is no more.
We have achieved all that I desired. Thanks to Gale, we are free.
Boo wants to reassure you that the boom was not him. It was the sound of Gale blowing up the brain.

EditorData.NodeContext: Reacting to a squeak from Boo. Stage whisper, a little harried - Boo's ruining what is meant to be a moment of reflection as you and the party stand and stare at the ruined - but saved! - skyline of Baldur's Gate

Text.Value: I can't feel the tadpole... they must have all died in the explosion - that means I can't turn into a mind flayer!
I can't feel the tadpole... they must have all died in the explosion - that means I can't turn into a mind flayer!

EditorData.NodeContext: Realisation and delight - she's finally free of the parasite.

Text.Value: A most noble sacrifice.
And the worm squirms no more! Boo need not worry that his seat on my skull will grow suddenly stickier with mind flayer juice.

EditorData.NodeContext: Joyous - happily saying he will no longer turn into a mind flayer

Text.Value: The wizard did it... he really did it. He blew up the brain.
The wizard didn't live to see himself cured. He gave his life for everyone else.
It seems that your sacrifice was not needed. Nonetheless, I hope you enjoy your newly uncovered potential.
But Gale... he's gone.
Of course, it did cost us a wizard. Poor Gale.
But Gale... he's gone.
With their lost Prince returned, our people will burn away Vlaakith's corruption. And it is all thanks to Gale - the wizard who destroyed a Netherbrain.
With their lost Prince returned, my people will burn away Vlaakith's corruption. And it is all thanks to Gale - the wizard who destroyed a Netherbrain.
He did it, he actually did it... he blew up the brain.
All that wisdom, lost, forever. All so that we could survive. I owe him my life. We all do.
The tadpole - I can't feel it anymore. Thanks to that bomb of his, I'm not going to turn into a mind flayer!
The tadpole - I can't feel it anymore. Thanks to that bomb of his, we're not going to turn into mind flayers!
He's a hero. A fucking hero.
He's a hero. A fucking hero.

EditorData.NodeContext: Karlach starting to flag; she's not feeling great (will die soon, but still on her feet for now).

Text.Value: All it cost was a single wizard.
It seems the wizard kept his nerve. He destroyed the brain.
*The brain is gone, and with it, the legions of tadpoles that it spawned. There will be no Grand Design, no domination, no enslaving of the land.*
All it cost us was our friend.
And all it cost was our friend.
